thread.title: Antonio Fantin Reclaims Paralympic Gold in 100m Freestyle S6
thread.title_full: Antonio Fantin Reclaims Paralympic Gold in 100m Freestyle S6

author: Redazione Web
title: Antonio Fantin Reclaims Paralympic Gold in 100m Freestyle S6
text: Antonio Fantin is still the king of the 100m freestyle S6. The Italian swimmer, after his triumph in Tokyo, won the Paralympic gold medal again with a perfect performance in the final where he gave no chance to his opponents. [Who is Alberto Amodeo, the Italian who triumphed in the 400m freestyle: age, career, the accident, and the passion for Lego](/sport/schede/alberto_amodeo_chi_e_paralimpiadi_incidente_medagia_oro_400_stile_libero_eta_carriera_passione_lego-8334161.html) The 23-year-old Italian secured the gold, repeating his success from 2021 and finishing in 1:03.12, a Paralympic record. Silver went to the Brazilian Talisson Henrique Glock (1:05.27), and bronze to the Frenchman Laurent Chardard. Who he is Antonio Fantin was born in Latisana on August 3, 2001. The Italian lives in Bibione and trains in Lignano Sabbiadoro, at the Bella Italia Village pool. He is just 23 years old but already has an impressive track record. Career and titles Antonio Fantin is the Paralympic champion in the 100m freestyle at the Tokyo 2020 Games, a 10-time world champion, and a 9-time European champion. He holds world and European records in the 50m and 100m freestyle. The Italian has just reaffirmed his gold medal in Paris, setting a new Paralympic record. The malformation and the passion for swimming Fantin was struck in February 2005, at the age of three and a half, by an arteriovenous malformation. He later approached the world of swimming as a form of post-operative rehabilitation, as he recounted in his autobiography. His nickname Antonio Fantin is nicknamed "the dolphin of Bibione". His world titles and two Paralympic golds have made him famous and highlighted his immense talent shown in the water. This article is automatically translated
